bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 11, 1916

div1.p: Carter writes that he has arrived at his destination safely and discusses yellow fever quarantine procedures.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 11, 1916

div1.p:
Arrived at 6. A. M. Am at Hotel Maury -
the label of which is on Laura's trunk. Only those
immune to y. f. were permitted to land - the
Gorgases, myself, Guiteras & Lyster. The others
stay aboard until tomorrow 6 P 5.30 P. M-
no earthly sense in it. The temperature here
is 10°C = 50°F & does not rise above it ab-
solutely steady - no stegomyia production here is
possible - now - below 60° is abo 65° is abso-
lutely safe - below 72° safe enough - so few
people understand the principles of Quar-
antine. Have been to see the Minister
C1
B20
- name unknown - who showed us his gar-
den - a beautiful one-

Cold as it is it is warmer than it has been
for the last 4 days- I am warm enough
have on 2 pair heavy drawers & one light one
2 heavy undershirts. It f is perfectly com-
fortable-

We expect to sail on the 14-or 15, instead of the
17; I think I will like it better - although I
was not comfortable aboard ship. My clothes
are suitable for hot weather- It is 6 or 7
days to Panama.- 6 if we go straight through
I will try to mail this this morning to go
off to da morrow, by the S. S. Chile-
div1.closer: Your loving husband H R. Carter who is well
